value.title: Power BI Developer in a Day
value.excerpt: The Power BI Developer in a Day online course empowers you as an app developer with the technical knowledge required to embed Power BI content. We recommend you watch the videos in the recorded sequence, starting with video 1 and ending with video 20.

topItems.title: Welcome and Course Introduction | Power BI Developer in a Day
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Peter Myers (Microsoft Most Valued Professional, and course developer) welcomes you to the course. It is video 1 of 21.  The Power BI Developer in a Day online course empowers you as an app developer with the technical knowledge required to embed Power BI content. We recommend you watch

It is video 3 of 21.  The Power BI Developer in a Day online course empowers you as an app developer with the technical

topItems.title: Module 1: Power BI Overview (Part 2 of 4) | Power BI Developer in a Day

It is video 4 of 21.  The Power BI Developer in a Day online

value.title: Taking Buttons in Power BI Desktop to the Next Level
value.excerpt: Amanda Cofsky joins us to show how you can use buttons, in Power BI Desktop, to take your reports to the next level. Blank buttons can really make your Power BI Reports shine.  Connect with Amanda on Twitter: https://twitter.com/MissAmandaN   ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: DAX Fridays #209: Open orders in DAX | Events in progress & Time intelligence
value.excerpt: In today's video, we are going to go through how to think about Time Intelligence calculations with a specific case: Calculating the number of open orders using DAX.  I read a million years ago a blog post from Gerhard where he explained how to do it and even though we are not going to use the same DAX

value.title: Create Buckets or Groups with Power Query in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are different ways you can create buckets or groups for your data in Power BI. Patrick shows you how this can be done with Power Query along with a few other options.  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Power BI Top 10 / Top N Filter)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a Power BI TOP N Report , using a Top 10 or Top N Filter. As a bonus we will also compare this with another approach using the DAX TOPN Function. üëâ Download Power BI File in Video at https://web.learnpowerbi.com/download/  This is part of our complete TOP N playlist

If you do not enable the feature, also

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Drilling into drillthrough in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can use the drillthrough feature within Power BI Desktop. He also looks at how you can drill to multiple fields at the same time. The back image can also be changed and Patrick shows you how to do it!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com --

value.excerpt: If you are showing an important measure value in the report, and you want to compare it with a target and see if it meets the target or not, The KPI visual comes in handy. The KPI Visual‚Äôs behavior, however, might be a bit hard to understand, In this article and video, I explained how this visual works,

value.title: Search Bar in Power BI Slicer
value.excerpt: If you have too many items in a slicer, such as the list of customer names, or product names, then finding one amongst the list takes time, unless you enable the search. Fortunately, the search is there for you, you just need to enable it, In this very short article and video, I‚Äôll explain where it is

value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Get started with Power BI Paginated Reports
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to create your first Paginated Report for Power BI, Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services.

topItems.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
topItems.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course

topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data.  Free Gateway Cube Sheet: https://guyinacu.be/gatewaystartpdf  Gateway Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway sizing: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/gateway-onprem-sizing
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Vlv1tbuZNcM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway

topItems.title: What the HECK is a Power BI Gateway Cluster?
topItems.excerpt: Confused about what a Power BI Gateway cluster is? Have your On-Premises Data Gateway installed but it's overloaded? This video is for you!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-high-availability-clusters  PowerShell: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-powershell-support

images.title: What the HECK is a Power BI Gateway Cluster?

topItems.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-sso-overview  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

images.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway

This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services

Get started with the Power BI Gateway

value.title: Design effective reports in Power BI
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces a design process to design and deliver compelling Power BI reports. It begins by describing a proven design process created by leading report design experts. The process encompasses phases to understand the report users and their requirements, explore pleasing report designs, and develop reports all the way into production.

topItems.title: Scope report design requirements
topItems.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

topItems.title: Structure analytical report designs in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Designing an analytical report involves understanding the requirements and its audience. However, designing a compelling analytical report requires understanding the automatic and unconscious processes that occur when report consumers comprehend what they see. When you have the knowledge of how to structure and apply report design principles, you can raise the level of your report designs to produce relevant, intuitive, and visually pleasing experiences for your report consumers.

topItems.title: Design Power BI reports
topItems.excerpt: Because Power BI includes more than 30 core visuals, it can be challenging for a beginner to select the correct visual. This module will guide you through selecting the most appropriate visual type to meet your design and report layout requirements.

topItems.title: Configure Power BI report filters
topItems.excerpt: Report filtering is a complex topic because many techniques are available for filtering a Microsoft Power BI report. However, with complexity comes control, allowing you to design reports that meet requirements and expectations.

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn many details about the most important DAX function: CALCULATE!

topItems.title: CALCULATE in DAX #01: Filters are tables
topItems.excerpt: Learn why all the CALCULATE filters are tables. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Tk-7gBt9CDE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
topItems.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cgIi3iFKOvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: CALCULATE in DAX #03: Remove single column filters
topItems.excerpt: Use REMOVEFILTERS in CALCULATE to clear the filter from a column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VPeo5PF4UTM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: CALCULATE in DAX #04: Add table filter (and difference with column filters)
topItems.excerpt: Learn the difference between table filters and column filters in CALCULATE. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EawkPc_iLs4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Introducing DAX 101 videos
topItems.excerpt: Introductive concepts and tasks to write DAX. Short and straight to the point!

topItems.title: Previous year up to a certain date
topItems.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. Article and download: https://sql.bi/352723?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

topItems.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
